p: Climate change can also adversely impact human health through its potential to affect the distribution of vector borne diseases [16]. Changes in temperature, rainfall and humidity can directly affect vector reproductive rates, host-seeking activity, vector development and population density as well as biting [17], [18], [19]. Vector survival can also be affected by the abundance and range of host species and habitat suitability which are also sensitive to changes in climate factors [19], [20].
